subject: History
title: The Ark of the Covenant
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Ark of the Covenant.

hook.text: The Ark of the Covenant held the Ten Commandments. It vanished from history around 587 BC and has never been found.

buildup.text: The Bible describes it as a gold-covered wooden chest carried by the Israelites and kept in Solomon's Temple.

discovery.text: When Babylon destroyed the Temple in 587 BC, the Ark disappeared from all records. No mention of it being taken.

twist.text: Ethiopia's Church claims to possess it in Axum. A guardian monk watches over it for life. No outsider has ever seen it.

climax.text: Other theories place it under the Temple Mount, in a cave in Jordan, or destroyed entirely by Babylonians.

punchline.text: The most sacred object in history simply vanished.

quiz.question: When did the Ark of the Covenant disappear from historical records?
options: During Moses's journey through the desert
When Babylon destroyed Solomon's Temple around 587 BC
When Rome conquered Jerusalem in 70 AD
